articles.author: Khushi Pal
articles.title: NASA’s stunning discovery of space: See 10 mind blowing images - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Here is a look at 10 mind-blowing images of universe captured by NASA.
articles.content:
By Khushi PalPublished Jun 27, 2024
Hindustan TimesIn FocusPhoto Credits: Instagram/nasa

articles.title: NASA entrusts SpaceX with $843 million ISS deorbit mission - WION

articles.content: NASA has signed a deal with SpaceX at $843 million for the vehicle that will deorbit the International Space Station as its service life comes to an end. Even better is the fact that this is just as … [+2368 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Two astronauts stuck on ISS as Boeing capsule faces technical woes - The Times of India
articles.description: US News: WASHINGTON: Problems with Boeing's Starliner capsule, still docked at the International Space Station, have upended the original plans for its return .

articles.author: Vidhee Tripathi
articles.title: NASA, SpaceX Launches Game-Changing Weather Satellite GOES-U; All You Need to Know - Jagran Josh
articles.description: SpaceX has launched NASA's final satellite for the NOAA program, enhancing continuous weather monitoring across the Western Hemisphere. This launch improves the US ability to monitor solar flares from eight-hour intervals to every 30 minutes. Everything you n…
articles.content:
On June 25, SpaceX achieved a successful launch of the fourth and final satellite for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) program.
According to NASA's statement, the GOES-R (G… [+2988 chars]

articles.author: Robert Lea
articles.title: James Webb Space Telescope spies strange shapes above Jupiter's Great Red Spot (image) - Space.com
articles.content: Using the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), astronomers have found previously unseen structures and activity in Jupiter's atmosphere above the Great Red Spot. These odd features seem to be caused by… [+4869 chars]

articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.title: 'Space potato' spotted by NASA Mars satellite is actually something much cooler - Livescience.com
articles.description: The starchy-looking moon Phobos, destined to crash into Mars' surface, has been revealed in new detail by NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. The 'space potato' image was recently shared on NASA's Instagram.
articles.content:
NASA has captured a stunning new photo of a "space potato" — but it is actually Phobos, the Martian moon that is locked on a slow collision course with the Red Planet.
The space agency recently imag… [+1803 chars]

articles.author: Harry Baker
articles.title: No, NASA hasn't warned of an impending asteroid strike in 2038. Here's what really happened. - Livescience.com
articles.description: Experts from NASA and other international organizations recently simulated their response to a hypothetical asteroid impact scenario. The test was deemed a success. However, several media outlets have misreported the group's findings.
articles.content: Multiple outlets have misreported newly released findings from the fifth Planetary Defense Interagency Tabletop Exercise. These misleading headlines either suggest that the hypothetical scenario used… [+7396 chars]

articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.title: Butterflies cross Atlantic ocean on 2600-mile non-stop flight never recorded in any insect before - Livescience.com
articles.description: Painted lady butterflies discovered in French Guiana — thousands of miles from their usual habitats — got there through a Herculean transoceanic flight.
articles.content:
Scientists have found the first evidence of insects crossing an entire ocean — after finding butterflies that made a 2,600-mile (4,200 kilometers) journey across the Atlantic.
Gerard Talavera
, an … [+4296 chars]

articles.title: Chang'e-6 mission milestone in international space collaboration - CGTN
articles.description: China's Chang'e-6 mission, which returned to Earth on Tuesday carrying the world's first samples from the far side of the moon, was a significant milestone in space science exploration. It was also an important step in international space cooperation,
articles.content: China's Chang'e-6 mission, which returned to Earth on Tuesday carrying the world's first samples from the far side of the moon, was a significant milestone in space science exploration. It was also a… [+3014 chars]

articles.description: Within the next 30 years, concentrations of ozone-damaging aluminum oxides in the atmosphere could increase by 650%.

articles.content:
